item.title: Early Images of Bend Studio’s Potential Next Game Reveal a Brand New Live-Service IP
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/bend-studio-live-serivce-images/

Early images of what could be a new live-service IP by Bend Studio’s have been posted online.

The images came from MP1st, who say that the images came from the portfolio of an undisclosed UI designer at Bend Studio who have been working there since March 2022. According to the outlet, the images originate from a Google Drive that where uploaded sometime in 2023, but it’s unclear on when exactly the images where taken.

They reveal that Bend Studio appears to be working on, or has worked on, some live-service military shooter.

As some people have already pointed out, the one image above appears to be some kind of central hub where players could interact. However, without knowing the full context of the images, it’s possible that this is just a design level for the game, to test out different aspects and isn’t intended for final use.

Job listings have already pointed to Bend Studio’s next game being some kind of live service, and with how the industry has been going all-in with Battle Royales and extraction shooters in the past few years, it isn’t difficult to imagine that Bend Studio could be going in that direction.

For now, though, we’ll have to wait and see what exactly they are developing.

At the time of this writing, Bend Studio’s next game has been in development for four to five years, so we should start to hear more about it soon.

item.title: Mafia The Old Country Trailer Leaks Online, Releasing Summer 2025
item.content:encoded:
https://insider-gaming.com/mafia-the-old-country-trailer/

A trailer for Mafia: The Old Country has leaked online, revealing that the game will be released in Summer 2025.

DJari2020 uploaded the short trailer, which is presumably an advertisement trailer and a snippet of the full one we’ll see at The Game Awards, to X (formerly Twitter).

You can watch the Mafia The Old Country trailer here.

Speaking with the uploader, he says that the trailer has been uploaded to YouTube as an ad all morning.

The official game description reads, “Uncover the origins of organized crime in Mafia: The Old Country, a gritty mob story set in the brutal underworld of 1900s Sicily.

Fight to survive in this dangerous and unforgiving era, with action brought to life by the authentic realism and rich storytelling that the critically acclaimed Mafia series is known for.

Join us for a closer look at Mafia: The Old Country in December 2024.”

The full trailer of Mafia The Old Country will appear at tonight’s Game Awards and is scheduled to release in Summer 2025 on the PC, PlayStation 5 and Xbox Series S|X.
